lethal: When a creature is reduced to 0 MP or below due to lethal drain, it is instead reduced to half their maximum MP below zero MP. If this is not possible, their MP reduces to the lowest value it can go to. This counts as a killing effect.
mana: Mana Drain is similar to damage, but it reduces MP instead of HP.
memory: Memory drain is identical to mana drain, but it is not blocked by silver. If you are dropped with Memory Drain then you forget the hour before you went down. If you are killed by memory drain, you automatically forget all the events of the day prior to your death. That is to say that you pull with one additional effective black stone as elves used to. Pulling one black stone will make you lose a level and two will make you PD. You always gain a permanent insanity from memory drain deaths.
wither: If a creature takes Wither, then they age a number of years equal to the amount of Wither that they took. This aging is relative to a 100 year lifespan, regardless of how long the creature's lifespan would naturally be.
